properties.name: 1 in 12
properties.description: Posted by Lordrich1 in 12, Bradford\'s anarchist club. (1988) (1981- )

properties.name: 36 Peckover Street
properties.description: Posted by Lordrich1870-80 Bethesda Methodist Chapel 1886 - ILP rent the building 1889 - ILP buy the building for £2200 1893 - (13th Jan) ILP Conference - Birth of Labour Party

properties.name: Albion Court
properties.description: Posted by LordrichGuiseppe\'s back yard. 1867 - Temperence Hotel.

properties.name: Bradford District Unemployed Association
properties.description: Posted by LordrichThornton Road, Bradford, UK1926-1939 Site of BDUA Harry Goldthorpe \'room at the bottom\' (1959), 1936 - Olympia Hall Fascist Rally.

properties.name: Cathedral
properties.description: Posted by Lordrich1458 - St Peter\'s Parish Church 1919 - Cathedral Stained glass windows from William Morris workshop. Defense point in English civil war when Royalists from Leeds tried invading Bradford

properties.name: Community Arts Centre
properties.description: Posted by Lordrich 1831 - Quaker School, built to provide education to the working class Currently the Community Arts Centre

properties.name: Dockers Square
properties.description: Posted by Lordrich1848 - Chartist Rising 1891 (13th April) - Riot during Manningham Mills Strike - 30,000 people

properties.name: Forster Square
properties.description: Posted by LordrichWilliam Forster - 1870 education act This is also roughly where Bradford canal finished, joining up with Leeds-Liverpool canal in Shipley. Hence \'Canal Road\'

properties.name: Holme Mill
properties.description: Posted by LordrichBradford1798 - site of first steam powered mill in Bradford. This area is where most of the mills appeared, with a fast-flowing beck behind the mill and another fast-flowing beck across the street.

properties.name: Ivegate Dungeon
properties.description: Posted by Lordrich1774 - John Nelson in Dungeon for preaching Methodism

properties.name: Kirkgate Market
properties.description: Posted by Lordrich1705-1870 Rawson Manor The current ugly building was built in the 1960s - corruption in the contract to build it. The previous building was similar to the markets in Leeds.

properties.name: Little Germany
properties.description: Posted by LordrichLargest collection of listed industrial buildings in UK

properties.name: Longlands
properties.description: Posted by Lordrich1901 - Council tenement flats. First council housing in the country.

properties.name: Market Cross
properties.description: Posted by LordrichThe original market, the cross used to be on the corner of Westgate, Kirkgate and Ivegate - exactly where the CCTV pole currently is. The stump remains in the entrance to Kirkgate market (this point) where there is a plaque

properties.name: Market Taven
properties.description: Posted by LordrichGreen Market Chartist rising 1840 (26/27th Jan) - 40 armed citizens

properties.name: Midland Hotel
properties.description: Posted by Lordrich so named because of the railway, the hotel was built at the end of the line for commercial people traveling. 1905 Sir Henry Irving died here after performing in Bradford, his manager being Bram Stoker.

properties.name: Odeon Cinema
properties.description: Posted by Lordrich 1930 - Odeon 1757 - Whittiler Brewery made \'Yorkshire Stingo\' here 1960 - Gene Vincent 1963 - Buddy Holly 1964-5 The Beatles

properties.name: Priestley Centre
properties.description: Posted by Lordrich1837 - Site of first Temperance Hall in UK 1921 - Becomes a \'Jowett Hall\' a Labour Church

properties.name: Provincal House
properties.description: Posted by LordrichLate 1960\'s - Provincal House (Demolished 1/9/02) 1964 - Site of \'Little Fat Black Pussy Cat\' - 1st gig - The Pretty Things 1310 - Site of Corn Mill (Millergate)

properties.name: Rawson Square
properties.description: Posted by Lordrich1862 - \'Schiller Verein\' - Club for German merchants. 1917 - Unity Hall - first display of Cottingley Fairies photos Currently Masonic Hall

properties.name: Shoulder of Mutton Pub
properties.description: Posted by Lordrich1825 - a typical pub from that era

properties.name: St Georges Hall
properties.description: Posted by LordrichBuilt 1853 to encourage middle-class people to become more cultured. Built using public money

properties.name: Star Pub
properties.description: Posted by Lordrich1956 Topic folk club, oldest running folk club. Has moved around a bit over the years - including a long stint at The Melborne

properties.name: Talbot Hotel
properties.description: Posted by Lordrich An opium den, frequented by the Bronte\'s brother.
